intro: Hirtella lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hirtella lanceolata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
